intro: Hydroglossum circinnatum, commonly known as the spiral waterwheel, is a rare aquatic plant native to the temperate regions of Europe. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and lakes. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of blue or violet. Hydroglossum circinnatum plays a role in maintaining aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates.
